class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.APIClient(api_client, API, config, logger)ÔÉÅ

Class for fetching data from an API using the requests library.

download_xml(directory, api_data)ÔÉÅ

Downloads the XML data to a specified directory.

Parameters:

  • directory ‚Äì The directory where the XML file will be saved.

  • api_data ‚Äì The XML data to be saved.

fetch_data(article_url, retries=3, delay=2)ÔÉÅ

Fetches data from the API using the provided article URL.

Parameters:

article_url ‚Äì The URL of the article to fetch data for.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DataCompletenessChecker(config, logger, publisher='PMC')ÔÉÅ

Class to check the completeness of data sections in API responses.

extract_namespaces(xml_element)ÔÉÅ

Extract all namespaces in use, including xlink.

has_links_in_section(section, namespaces: dict[str, str]) → boolÔÉÅ

Check if the given section contains any external links.

Parameters:

  • section ‚Äì The section element to search for links.

  • namespaces ‚Äì Namespaces to use for XML parsing.

Returns:

True if links are found, False otherwise.

has_target_section(raw_data, section_name: str) → boolÔÉÅ

Check if the target section (data availability or supplementary data) exists in the raw data.

Parameters:

  • raw_data ‚Äì Raw XML data.

  • section_name ‚Äì Name of the section to check.

Returns:

True if the section is found with relevant links, False otherwise.

is_xml_data_complete(raw_data, url, required_sections=['data_availability', 'supplementary_data']) → boolÔÉÅ

Check if required sections are present in the raw_data. Return True if all required sections are present.

Parameters:

  • raw_data ‚Äì Raw XML data.

  • url ‚Äì The URL of the article.

  • required_sections ‚Äì List of required sections to check.

Returns:

True if all required sections are present, False otherwise.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DataFetcher(config, logger, src='WebScraper')ÔÉÅ
update_DataFetcher_settings(url, entire_doc_model, logger, HTML_fallback=False)ÔÉÅ

Sets up either a web scraper or API client based on the URL domain. Also used to avoid re_instantiating another selenium webdriver.

Parameters:

  • url ‚Äì The URL to fetch data from.

  • entire_doc_model ‚Äì Flag to indicate if the entire document model is being used.

  • logger ‚Äì The logger instance for logging messages.

  • HTML_fallback ‚Äì Flag to indicate if HTML fallback is needed.

Returns:

An instance of the appropriate data fetcher (WebScraper or APIClient).

url_in_dataframe(url)ÔÉÅ

Checks if the given doi / pmcid is present in the DataFrame.

Parameters:

url ‚Äì The URL to check.

Returns:

True if the URL is found, False otherwise.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DatabaseFetcher(config, logger)ÔÉÅ

Class for fetching data from a DataFrame.

fetch_data(url_key, retries=3, delay=2)ÔÉÅ

Fetches data from a local file or database.

Parameters:

url_key ‚Äì The key to identify the data in the database.

Returns:

The raw HTML content of the page.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.WebScraper(scraper_tool, config, logger)ÔÉÅ

Class for fetching data from web pages using Selenium.

download_file_from_url(url, output_root, paper_id)ÔÉÅ

Downloads a file from the given URL and saves it to the specified directory.

Parameters:

  • url ‚Äì The URL to download the file from.

  • output_root ‚Äì The root directory where the file will be saved.

  • paper_id ‚Äì The ID of the paper, used to create a subdirectory.

download_html(dir)ÔÉÅ

Downloads the HTML content to a specified directory.

Parameters:

dir ‚Äì The directory where the HTML file will be saved.

fetch_data(url, retries=3, delay=2)ÔÉÅ

Fetches data from the given URL, by simulating user scroll, waiting some delay time and doing multiple retries to allow for page load and then get the source html

Parameters:

  • url ‚Äì The URL to fetch data from.

  • retries ‚Äì Number of retries in case of failure.

  • delay ‚Äì Delay time between retries.

Returns:

The raw HTML content of the page.

get_opendata_from_pubmed_id(pmid)ÔÉÅ

Given a PubMed ID, fetches the corresponding PMC ID and DOI from PubMed.

Parameters:

pmid ‚Äì The PubMed ID to fetch data for.

Returns:

A tuple containing the PMC ID and DOI.

get_publication_name_from_driver()ÔÉÅ

Extracts the publication name from the WebDriver‚Äôs current page title. Remark: this should be called after scraper_tool.get(url) to ensure the page is loaded.

Returns:

The publication name as a string.

normalize_HTML(html, keep_tags=None)ÔÉÅ

Normalize the HTML content by removing unnecessary tags and attributes.

Parameters:

  • html ‚Äì The raw HTML content to be normalized.

  • keep_tags ‚Äì List of tags to keep in the HTML content. May be useful for some servers that host target info inside specific tags (e.g., <form> or <script>) that are otherwise removed by the scraper.

Returns:

The normalized HTML content.

normalize_links(links_raw_dict)ÔÉÅ

Convert Selenium WebElement objects to strings and keep existing string links unchanged.
